comment: If they can't win to control it, they want it destroyed. They didn't win the last Presidential Election, so they want to abolish the Electoral College. When they lose, in November, they're gonna want to abolish Congress and the Senate. I'm wondering when they'll just commit mass suicide.
amr:

(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (w / want-01
            :ARG0 (t / they)
            :ARG1 (d / destroy-01

                  :polarity -
                  :ARG1 (w2 / win-01
                        :ARG0 t
                        :ARG2 (c / control-01
                              :ARG0 t
                              :ARG1 (ii2 / it)))))
      :snt2 (c2 / cause-01

                  :ARG0 (t2 / they)
                  :ARG2 (e / elect-01
                        :ARG2 (p2 / president)
                        :mod (l / last)))
            :ARG1 (w4 / want-01
                  :ARG0 t2
                  :ARG1 (a / abolish-01
                        :ARG0 t2

      :snt3 (w5 / want-01
            :ARG0 (t3 / they)
            :ARG1 (a2 / abolish-01

                  :ARG1 (a3 / and
                        :op1 (g / government-organization

                                    :op1 "Congress"))
                        :op2 (g2 / government-organization
                              :name (n2 / name
                                    :op1 "Senate"))))
            :time (l2 / lose-03
                  :ARG0 t3
                  :time (d2 / date-entity

      :snt4 (w6 / wonder-01
            :ARG0 (ii3 / i)
            :ARG1 (t4 / time
                  :time-of (c4 / commit-02
                        :ARG0 (t5 / they)
                        :ARG1 (s / suicide
                              :mod (m2 / mass))
                        :mod (j / just)))))

comment: Hey, democrat here. I, and everyone I know, don't want to abolish Congress, the Senate, or the Supreme Court. However, arguments could be made that the Supreme Court needs term limits, and that the electoral college is outdated. Have a nice day.
amr:
# ::snt Hey, democrat here. I, and everyone I know, don't want to abolish Congress, the Senate, or the Supreme Court. However, arguments could be made that the Supreme Court needs term limits, and that the electoral college is outdated. Have a nice day.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (d / democrat
            :location (h / here)
            :mod (h2 / hey
                  :mode expressive))
      :snt2 (w / want-01
            :polarity -
            :ARG0 (a / and
                  :op1 (ii / i)
                  :op2 (e / everyone
                        :ARG1-of (k / know-02

            :ARG1 (a2 / abolish-01
                  :ARG0 a
                  :ARG1 (o / or
                        :op1 (g / government-organization
                              :name (n / name
                                    :op1 "Congress"))
                        :op2 (g2 / government-organization
                              :name (n2 / name
                                    :op1 "Senate"))
                        :op3 (g3 / government-organization
                              :name (n3 / name
                                    :op1 "Supreme"
                                    :op2 "Court")))))
